_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:14:44 using v2.1
title: How has all age all cause  mortality changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The mortality rate from all causes have been falling steadily since 2000-02 and is one indication that as a society we are generally living longer. In fact, this is part of a much longer term secular trend for reductions in mortality. Male mortality rates are consistently higher than those for females, although male rates have reduced more between 2000 and 2011 (22% reduction are compared with 18% for females).
